title: Roman Aries: Aries
caption:
How did the Roman tradition see Aries? ♈

Roman Name: Aries
Myth: Golden Ram of Phrixus

Aries, the Ram, is the fire sign of leadership and courage. In myth the celestial ram carried Phrixus to safety; his golden fleece would later be sought by Jason. Aries is ruled by Mars (the war god) and represents new beginnings and bold action.

title: Greek Aries: Aries (Chrysomallus)
caption:
How did the Greek tradition see Aries? ♈

Greek Name: Aries (Chrysomallus)
Myth: Golden Ram and the Fleece

The flying ram Chrysomallus rescued Phrixus and Helle and carried them to safety, later becoming the Golden Fleece. Zeus honored this ram by placing it among the stars as the constellation Aries. As the first sign, it symbolizes beginnings, leadership and the bold energy of spring.

Every culture that gazed at the stars found its own meaning in the constellation we call Aries. The Greek perspective reveals how fire energy and the archetype of The Pioneer were understood in a completely different world.

title: Pisces ♓: The Mystic
caption:
Who is Pisces? ♓

Element: Water | Modality: Mutable | Ruling Planet: Jupiter
Dates: February 19 – March 20 | House: 12

Pisces embodies the final stage of the zodiac, where the focus is on spiritual enlightenment, compassion, and the dissolution of the ego. This phase is about merging with the universal, understanding the interconnectedness of all life, and letting go of individual identity to experience the oneness of existence. It's a time of introspection, dreams, and transcending material concerns.

The archetype of The Mystic represents Transcendence and Spirituality. Across cultures, this sign has taken many forms — from the Aphrodite and Eros as Fish of Rome to the Meena of Vedic tradition.
